bibl.title: Dispatch from L de R du Verge to John Davis
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

div1.p: and specially at the southern ports of Benguella and Catumbella where large caravans of two and three thousand negroes are constantly arriving from the interior, bringing along with their produce numbers of young blacks for sale or barter; they average in ages from infancy to full grown adults, and always find a ready market with brisk competition.

From the small seaport of Novo-Redondo South of Loanda, an export trade has been regularly carried on for more than five years by the agents and on account of the Bank Alltramarine of Lisbon. The agent form this port is a Mr Patricio Alvares, and although certain forms are carried out as prescribed by their emigration laws, it is well known that as soon as they are landed at St Thomas, and that by the hundreds. they are treated, conducted and consi- dered
